subject: Re: GUI for JUnit tests from console
msgSnippet: ... Test ... junit.awtui or ... Class ... Indeed, it works! I don t know what i done but many thanks for your help! :)
messageBody:
--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, Ilja Preuss <it@...> wrote:
>
> isowitz schrieb:
> > I have an AllTest class. In that class I have the "public static
Test
> > suite()" methode where I add my tests.
> >
> > For users who hasn't installed an IDE I add a main methode:
> > public static void main(String args[]) throws Exception {
> > junit.textui.TestRunner.run(suite());
> > }
> > So they can start the tests on the console. That works great.
> > But only when I use the textui. It's not possible to use
junit.awtui or
> > junit.swingui. It's because junit.awtui and junit.swingui needs a
Class
> > and not a Test.
>
> Have you tried AllTest.class? Should work, if I remember correctly.
>
> Cheers, Ilja
>

Indeed, it works! I don't know what i done but many thanks for your
help! :)
